meanings.definition: A children's game played with small objects or stones
meanings.sent1: During recess, the kids gathered to play skelly with their small stones.
meanings.sent2: The children enjoyed playing skelly with their friends after school.
meanings.sent3: The skelly game was so fun that even the teachers wanted to join in!
meanings.sent4: Her backyard turned into a skelly battlefield, with stones flying everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the skelly stones hitting the ground echoed through the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: A person who is skilled at playing skelly
meanings.sent1: Tommy was known as the skelly champion in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The skelly expert showed the new players how to improve their game.
meanings.sent3: The skelly master could make the stones dance on the ground with precision.
meanings.sent4: She was a skelly wizard, always winning against her opponents.
meanings.sent5: The skelly prodigy amazed everyone with his incredible moves and strategies.

meanings.definition: To engage in the game of skelly
meanings.sent1: The kids would skelly in the park every weekend, laughing and having fun.
meanings.sent2: After finishing their homework, the siblings would skelly in the backyard.
meanings.sent3: They decided to skelly instead of watching TV, enjoying the fresh air outside.
meanings.sent4: The friends planned to skelly all day long during the summer break.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, they continued to skelly under the streetlights, not wanting to stop the game.
